intro: Gyrostachys vernalis, commonly known as the spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its early blooming period in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Gyrostachys vernalis is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in early-season pollination and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
